perturbation.original_text: This Statement of Work is issued to and made part of that Software Development Agreement executed by and between Developer and Client on the Effective Date (the Agreement). Any word or phrase not otherwise defined in this Appendix will have the meaning ascribed in the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: This Statement of Work is issued to and made part of that Software Development Agreement executed by and between Seattle Software Developers and Pelican Delivers on the Effective Date (the Agreement). Any word or phrase not otherwise defined in this Appendix will have the meaning ascribed in this Statement of Work.
perturbation.explanation: The original text refers to 'Developer and Client,' defining their roles through the encompassing 'Agreement.' The modified text names 'Seattle Software Developers and Pelican Delivers,' but ambiguously suggests that undefined terms derive meaning from the current 'Statement of Work' instead of the main 'Agreement,' causing confusion and uncertainty in interpretation of key terms.

perturbation.original_text:
Payment Schedule: Client shall pay Developer:
20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1. 20% ($55,800.00) to be
paid upon completion of Milestone #2.
20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3.
20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.
perturbation.changed_text:
Payment Schedule: Customer shall remit payment to the Vendor:
20% Deposit ($55,800.00) to be paid at the start of the project. 20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #1. 20% ($55,800.00) to be
paid upon completion of Milestone #2.
20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #3.
20% ($55,800.00) to be paid upon completion of Milestone #4.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Client' to 'Customer' and 'Developer' to 'Vendor' introduces ambiguity. The original contract clearly defines 'Client' and 'Developer'. Using different terms creates uncertainty about which entities are responsible for payment and service delivery, respectively.

perturbation.original_text:
If no drivers are found, users will not be charged and will have the option to pick up the order in-store or browse for a
new dispensary
Customers will receive updates on the status of their order via SMS, email, or website
perturbation.changed_text:
If no delivery personnel are found, patrons will not be charged and will have the option to pick up the order in-store or browse for a
new dispensary
Clients will receive updates on the status of their order via SMS, email, or website
perturbation.explanation: Switching 'drivers' to 'delivery personnel,' 'users' to 'patrons,' and 'customers' to 'clients' without defining them introduces inconsistencies. The original text has used 'users' and 'customers' somewhat interchangeably up to this point, but now 'patrons' and 'clients' are introduced with no clear connection, making it uncertain who receives order updates and who can pick up in-store. Is a 'client' the same as a 'patron'?
perturbation.location: 5. Statement of Work - Website (Customer Portal) - Check out
